answers.answer: I'm definitely overweighttttttttt  and short even prior to my first pregnancy (this is the second) and baby and I were both healthy and had an easy breezy delivery (c section). I'm currently pregnant with baby#2 and we're both doing great...aside from mommy getting hyperemesis the entire time with my first and still have it at 20 weeks with this one. So, whatever you do...stay positive and follow doctors orders and you'll be fine.Best wishes and congrats :-)
I am as well I have GD and I have HG just have to be careful of what I eat but yeah stay positive and baby should be fine

I wasn't with my first but was with 2nd baby I had via csec in April and and pregnant again and have been stressing about not being able to lose the weight because I got pregnant so fast. But I am super excited because it has taken 11 years of trying to get our babies :-D

My bmi was 31 and I was sent to a fat consultant, I have always weighed more than what I look tbh and I didn't feel huge but knew I was overweight the consultant basically laughed it off and sent me straight back to midwives care. It depends how big you are really as there is more chance of us bigger mummies getting diabetes and few other complications but as long as you get enough exercise and eat your 5 a day and avoid too much sugar you will be fine, I feel fine and have no problems don't stress about it too much because honestly there is no need x

I am overweight as well, there is a higher risk for larger babies and gestational diabetes like the other ladies mentioned. My doctor is having me deliver via c-section but it's not a weight related decision. She said eat when I feel hungry and cut back on sugary foods/beverages. She said not to worry about the weight and just focus on having a healthy pregnancy :)
Thank you ladies. I Do Feel better.  I am trying to walk more and eat better but it is a struggle. :) I'm taking it day by day

I have always been over weight and I am currently 8+4 with my 4th baby. I haven't had any of the complications that are often associated with overweight pregnancy and do my best to be active and eat healthy.

question: Is any one over weight and expecting?  I'm so concerned that something can go wrong.
title: over weight and pregnant.
